thread.title: Things to do this weekend, Oct. 16-18
thread.title_full: Things to do this weekend, Oct. 16-18

title: Things to do this weekend, Oct. 16-18
text: Legal Information Things to do this weekend, Oct. 16-18 Get a good sight of the stars, check out a bodybuilding competition or make a Lego design this weekend in Cheyenne and the Front Range area. Planetarium offers show on science, science fiction The University of Wyoming Planetarium, located in the basement of the Physical Science Building, will host a show Oct. 16 at 7 p.m. discussing sci-fi books, movies and shows, along with the science behind them. A U2 laser light show will follow. Prices are $3 for students and $4 for non-students. Tickets can be purchased online at www.uwyo.edu/physics . Bodybuilding competition held Saturday The Wyo Yellowstone Championship competition, featuring bodybuilding, bikini and fitness competitions will be held Oct. 17 at 6 p.m. at the Cheyenne Civic Center, 510 W. 20th St. Tickets are $40. www.cheyenneciviccenter.org Library hosts Lego building The Laramie County Library, 2200 Pioneer Ave., will hold a Lego building afternoon Saturday from 3:30 p.m. to 4:30 p.m. Kids in kindergarten through sixth grade can design their own Lego project and have it displayed on a shelf for the library patrons to see. "My Fair Lady" to be screened for 50th anniversary The Audrey Hepburn classic, "My Fair Lady" will be screened at the Capitol Stadium, 3410 Concord Rd., Sunday at 2 p.m. and 7 p.m. and Tuesday at 7 p.m. in honor of the film's 50th anniversary. Tickets can be purchased at www.wyomovies.com Roller derby team to hold co-ed mixer The Cheyenne Capidolls will host a homecoming bout Saturday at 7 p.m. featuring a three-team, co-ed mixer at Roller City, 5506 Weaver Road. Published on: Thursday, Oct 15, 2015 - 12:51:11 pm MDT Call: 307.633.3117
